Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style or black-figured Komast or Animal, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; trace of two added white bands; exterior: single dot pattern between dilute lines at rim; reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The rim pattern is rudimentary and crudely executed, as it generally is on Black Figure Komast and Animal chalices. For parallels regarding the rim pattern, see Lemos, no. 1611 from Pitane and British Museum 1888,0601.548.n. The number 71 is written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 20.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1230) (phase 2)
